member.summary: This event is triggered every time the accordion starts to change.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionMethod
member.summary: Operations supported by Accordion.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionMethod.Activate
member.summary: Activate a content part of the Accordion programmatically. The index can be a zero-indexed number to match the position of the header to close or a Selector matching an element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionMethod.Destroy
member.summary: The destroy() method cleans up all common data, events, etc. and then delegates out to _destroy() for custom cleanup.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionMethod.Resize
member.summary: Recompute heights of the accordion contents when using the fillSpace option and the container height changed. For example, when the container is a resizable, this method should be called by its resize-event.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionObject
member.summary: Convert a pair of headers and content panels into an accordion.

remarks.para: Make the selected elements Accordion widgets.
The markup of your accordion container needs pairs of headers and content panels:
If you use a different element for the header, specify the header-option with an appropriate selector, eg. header: 'a.header'. The content element must be always next to its header.
If you have links inside a accordion panel and use a-elements as headers, add a class to them and use that as the header, eg. header: 'a.header'.
Use activate(Number) to change the active panel programmatically.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.WidgetObject
member.summary: Create stateful jQuery plugins using the same abstraction that all jQuery UI widgets.

remarks.para: You can create new widgets from scratch, using just the $.Widget object as base to inherit from, or you can explicitly inherit from existing jQuery UI or third-party widgets. Defining a widget with the same name as you inherit from even allows you to extend widgets in place.
For now, more details can be found at github.com/scottgonzalez/widget-factory-docs/

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.WidgetObject.Create
member.summary: This is the widget's constructor.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.WidgetObject.Init
member.summary:
Widgets have the concept of initialization that is distinct from creation. Any time the plugin is called with no arguments or with only an option hash, the widget is initialized; this includes when the widget is created.
Initialization should only be handled if there is a logical action to perform on successive calls to the widget with no arguments.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.WidgetObject.Trigger(System.String,jQueryApi.jQueryEvent,System.Object)
member.summary:
Triggers an event and its associated callback.
The option with the name equal to type is invoked as the callback.
The event name is the widget name + type.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.WidgetObject.Destroy
member.summary: The destroy() method cleans up all common data, events, etc. and then delegates out to _destroy() for custom cleanup.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionObject.Activate
member.summary: Activate a content part of the Accordion programmatically. The index can be a zero-indexed number to match the position of the header to close or a Selector matching an element.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionObject.Resize
member.summary: Recompute heights of the accordion contents when using the fillSpace option and the container height changed. For example, when the container is a resizable, this method should be called by its resize-event.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption
member.summary: Options for use with Accordion.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Active
member.summary:
The zero-based index of the panel that is active (open). A negative value select panels going backward from the last panel.
When collapsible is set to true, a false value closes the accordion, otherwise nothing happens

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Animated
member.summary: Choose your favorite animation, or disable them (set to false). In addition to the default, 'bounceslide' and all defined easing methods are supported ('bounceslide' requires UI Effects Core).

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.AutoHeight
member.summary: If set, the highest content part is used as height reference for all other parts. Provides more consistent animations.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.ClearStyle
member.summary: If set, clears height and overflow styles after finishing animations. This enables accordions to work with dynamic content. Won't work together with autoHeight.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Collapsible
member.summary: Whether all the sections can be closed at once. Allows collapsing the active section.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the accordion if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Event
member.summary: The event on which to trigger the accordion.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.FillSpace
member.summary: If set, the accordion completely fills the height of the parent element. Overrides autoheight.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Header
member.summary:
Selector for the header element.
Must be a selector that applies to the accordion container element, via .find()
The default covers both ul/li accordions, as well as flat structures like dl/dt/dd

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Icons
member.summary:
Icons to use for headers, matching an icon defined by the jQuery UI CSS Framework. Set to false to have no icons displayed.
header (string, default: "ui-icon-triangle-1-e")
activeHeader (string, default: "ui-icon-triangle-1-s")

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.Navigation
member.summary: If set, looks for the anchor that matches location.href and activates it. Great for href-based state-saving. Use navigationFilter to implement your own matcher.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionOption.NavigationFilter
member.summary: Overwrite the default location.href-matching with your own matcher.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents
member.summary: Events raised by AutoComplete.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Change
member.summary: Triggered when the field is blurred, if the value has changed; ui.item refers to the selected item.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Close
member.summary: When the list is hidden - doesn't have to occur together with a change.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Create
member.summary: This event is triggered when the autocomplete is created.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Focus
member.summary:
Before focus is moved to an item (not selecting), ui.item refers to the focused item. The default action of focus is to replace the text field's value with the value of the focused item, though only if the focus event was triggered by a keyboard interaction.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu item from being focused.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Open
member.summary: Triggered when the suggestion menu is opened or updated.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Response
member.summary: Triggered after a request (source-option) completes, before the menu is shown. Useful for local manipulation of suggestion data, where a custom source-option callback is not required.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Search
member.summary: Before a request (source-option) is started, after minLength and delay are met. Can be canceled, then no request will be started and no items suggested.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteEvents.Select
member.summary:
Triggered when an item is selected from the menu; ui.item refers to the selected item. The default action of select is to replace the text field's value with the value of the selected item.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu from closing.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteMethod
member.summary: Operations supported by AutoComplete.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteMethod.Close
member.summary: Close the Autocomplete menu. Useful in combination with the search method, to close the open menu.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteMethod.Destroy
member.summary: The destroy() method cleans up all common data, events, etc. and then delegates out to _destroy() for custom cleanup.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteMethod.Search
member.summary: Triggers a search event, which, when data is available, then will display the suggestions; can be used by a selectbox-like button to open the suggestions when clicked. If no value argument is specified, the current input's value is used. Can be called with an empty string and minLength: 0 to display all items.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject
member.summary: Autocomplete, when added to an input field, enables users to quickly find and select from a pre-populated list of values as they type, leveraging searching and filtering.

remarks.para: By giving an Autocomplete field focus or entering something into it, the plugin starts searching for entries that match and displays a list of values to choose from. By entering more characters, the user can filter down the list to better matches.

This can be used to enter previous selected values, for example you could use Autocomplete for entering tags, to complete an address, you could enter a city name and get the zip code, or maybe enter email addresses from an address book.

You can pull data in from a local and/or a remote source: Local is good for small data sets (like an address book with 50 entries), remote is necessary for big data sets, like a database with hundreds or millions of entries to select from.
Autocomplete can be customized to work with various data sources, by just specifying the source option.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Close
member.summary: Close the Autocomplete menu. Useful in combination with the search method, to close the open menu.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Search(System.String)
member.summary: Triggers a search event, which, when data is available, then will display the suggestions; can be used by a selectbox-like button to open the suggestions when clicked. If no value argument is specified, the current input's value is used. Can be called with an empty string and minLength: 0 to display all items.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption
member.summary: Options for use with AutoComplete.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption.AppendTo
member.summary: Which element the menu should be appended to. Override this when the autocomplete is inside a position:fixed element. Otherwise the popup menu would still scroll with the page.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption.AutoFocus
member.summary: If set to true the first item will be automatically focused.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption.Delay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds the Autocomplete waits after a keystroke to activate itself. A zero-delay makes sense for local data (more responsive), but can produce a lot of load for remote data, while being less responsive.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the autocomplete if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption.MinLength
member.summary: The minimum number of characters a user has to type before the Autocomplete activates. Zero is useful for local data with just a few items. Should be increased when there are a lot of items, where a single character would match a few thousand items.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption.Position
member.summary: Identifies the position of the Autocomplete widget in relation to the associated input element. The "of" option defaults to the input element, but you can specify another element to position against. You can refer to the [http://docs.jquery.com/UI/Position jQuery UI Position] utility for more details about the various options.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOption.Source
member.summary:
Defines the data to use, must be specified.
Independent of the variant you use, the label is always treated as text. If you want the label to be treated as html you can use [https://github.com/scottgonzalez/jquery-ui-extensions/blob/master/autocomplete/jquery.ui.autocomplete.html.js Scott González' html extension]. The demos all focus on different variations of the source-option - look for the one that matches your use case, and take a look at the code.

member.summary: Refreshes the visual state of the button. Useful for updating button state after the native element's checked or disabled state is changed programatically.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject
member.summary: Themable button and buttonsets

remarks.para: Button enhances standard form elements like button, input of type submit or reset or anchors to themable buttons with appropiate mouseover and active styles.

In addition to basic push buttons, radio buttons and checkboxes (inputs of type radio and checkbox) can be converted to buttons: Their associated label is styled to appear as the button, while the underlying input is updated on click.

In order to group radio buttons, Button also provides an additional widget-method, called buttonset. Its used by selecting a container element (which contains the radio buttons) and calling buttonset(). Buttonset will also provide visual grouping, and therefore should be used whenever you have a group of buttons. It works by selecting all descendents and applying button() to them. You can enable and disable a buttonset, which will enable and disable all contained buttons. Destroying a buttonset also calls each button's destroy method.
When using an input of type button, submit or reset, support is limited to plain text labels with no icons.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the visual state of the button. Useful for updating button state after the native element's checked or disabled state is changed programatically.

member.summary: Options for use with Button.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the button if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonOption.Icons
member.summary: Icons to display, with or without text (see text option). The primary icon is displayed by default on the left of the label text, the secondary by default is on the right. Value for the primary and secondary properties must be a classname (String), eg. "ui-icon-gear". For using only one icon: icons: {primary:'ui-icon-locked'}. For using two icons: icons: {primary:'ui-icon-gear',secondary:'ui-icon-triangle-1-s'}

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonOption.Label
member.summary: Text to show on the button. When not specified (null), the element's html content is used, or its value attribute when it's an input element of type submit or reset; or the html content of the associated label element if its an input of type radio or checkbox

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonOption.Text
member.summary: Whether to show any text - when set to false (display no text), icons (see icons option) must be enabled, otherwise it'll be ignored.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonSetObject
member.summary: Themable buttonset

remarks.para: In order to group radio buttons, Button also provides an additional widget-method, called buttonset. Its used by selecting a container element (which contains the radio buttons) and calling buttonset(). Buttonset will also provide visual grouping, and therefore should be used whenever you have a group of buttons. It works by selecting all descendents and applying button() to them. You can enable and disable a buttonset, which will enable and disable all contained buttons. Destroying a buttonset also calls each button's destroy method.
When using an input of type button, submit or reset, support is limited to plain text labels with no icons.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.PositionObject
member.summary: Place an element relative to another

remarks.para: Utility script for positioning any widget relative to the window, document, a particular element, or the cursor/mouse.

para.em: Note: jQuery UI does not support positioning hidden elements.

remarks.para: This is a standalone jQuery plugin and has no dependencies on other jQuery UI components.

This plugin extends jQuery's built-in position getter method. If you forget to include this plugin, code calling position() won't fail directly, as the method still exists. But it'll just retrieve the position instead of setting it.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOption
member.summary: Options for use with Position.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOption.At
member.summary: Defines which position on the target element to align the positioned element against: "horizontal vertical" alignment. A single value such as "right" will default to "right center", "top" will default to "center top" (following CSS convention). Acceptable values: "top", "center", "bottom", "left", "right". Example: "left top" or "center center". Each dimension can also contains offsets, in pixels or percent, e.g. `right+10 top-25%`. A perecentage is relative to the target element.

summary.para: When the positioned element overflows the window in some direction, move it to an alternative position. Similar to my and at, this accepts a single value or a pair for horizontal/vertical, eg. "flip", "fit", "fit flip", "fit none".

ul.li: flip: to the opposite side and the collision detection is run again to see if it will fit. Whichever side allows more of the element to be visible will be used.
fit: so the element keeps in the desired direction, but is re-positioned so it fits.
flipfit: apply both flip and fit. If flip works out, fit won't do anything, if flip gives up, fit should help.
none: no collision detection.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOption.My
member.summary: Defines which position on the element being positioned to align with the target element: "horizontal vertical" alignment. A single value such as "right" will default to "right center", "top" will default to "center top" (following CSS convention). Acceptable values: "top", "center", "bottom", "left", "right". Example: "left top" or "center center". Each dimension can also contains offsets, in pixels or percent, e.g. `right+10 top-25%`. A perecentage is relative to the element being positioned.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOption.Of
member.summary: Element to position against. If you provide a selector or jQuery object, the first matching element will be used. If you provide an event object, the pageX and pageY properties will be used. Example: "#top-menu"

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOption.Offset
member.summary: Add these left-top values to the calculated position, eg. "50 50" (left top) A single value such as "50" will apply to both.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOption.Using
member.summary:
When specified the actual property setting is delegated to this callback. Receives two parameters: The first is a hash of top and left values for the position that should be set and can be forwarded to offset() or animate() calls.
The second provides feedback about the position and dimensions of both elements, as well as calculations to their relative position. Both `target` and `element` have these properties: element, left, top, width, height. In addition, there's `horizontal`, `vertical` and `important`, giving you twelve potential directions like { horizontal: "center", vertical: "left", important: "horizontal" }.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.WidgetMethod.Init
member.summary:
Widgets have the concept of initialization that is distinct from creation. Any time the plugin is called with no arguments or with only an option hash, the widget is initialized; this includes when the widget is created.
Initialization should only be handled if there is a logical action to perform on successive calls to the widget with no arguments.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.WidgetMethod.SetOptions
member.summary:
Called with a hash of key/value pairs to set whenever the option() method is called, regardless of the form in which option() was called.
Overriding this is useful if you can defer processor-intensive changes for multiple option changes.

The event name is the widget name + type.

member.summary: The function takes a date as a parameter and must return an array with [0] equal to true/false indicating whether or not this date is selectable, [1] equal to a CSS class name(s) or "" for the default presentation, and [2] an optional popup tooltip for this date. It is called for each day in the datepicker before it is displayed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerEvents.OnClose
member.summary: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker is closed, whether or not a date is selected. The function receives the selected date as text ("" if none) and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

member.summary: Sets the current date for the datepicker. The new date may be a Date object or a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|date format]] (e.g. '01/26/2009'), a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +7d'), or null to clear the selected date.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerObject
member.summary: Select a date from a popup or inline calendar

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Datepicker is a highly configurable plugin that adds datepicker functionality to your pages. You can customize the date format and language, restrict the selectable date ranges and add in buttons and other navigation options easily.
By default, the datepicker calendar opens in a small overlay onFocus and closes automatically onBlur or when a date is selected. For an inline calendar, simply attach the datepicker to a div or span.
You can use keyboard shortcuts to drive the datepicker:

ul.li: page up/down - previous/next month
ctrl+page up/down - previous/next year
ctrl+home - current month or open when closed
ctrl+left/right - previous/next day
ctrl+up/down - previous/next week
enter - accept the selected date
ctrl+end - close and erase the date
escape - close the datepicker without selection
$.datepicker.setDefaults( settings ) - Set settings for all datepicker instances.
$.datepicker.formatDate( format, date, settings ) - Format a date into a string value with a specified format.
$.datepicker.parseDate( format, value, settings ) - Extract a date from a string value with a specified format.
$.datepicker.iso8601Week( date ) - Determine the week of the year for a given date: 1 to 53.
$.datepicker.noWeekends - Set as beforeShowDay function to prevent selection of weekends.

remarks.para: Datepicker provides support for localizing its content to cater for different languagesand date formats. Each localization is contained within its own file with thelanguage code appended to the name, e.g. jquery.ui.datepicker-fr.js for French.The desired localization file should be included after the main datepicker code. They add their settings to the setof available localizations and automatically apply them as defaults for all instances.

The $.datepicker.regional attribute holds an array of localizations,indexed by language code, with "" referring to the default (English). Each entry isan object with the following attributes: closeText, prevText,nextText, currentText, monthNames,monthNamesShort, dayNames, dayNamesShort,dayNamesMin, weekHeader, dateFormat,firstDay, isRTL, showMonthAfterYear,and yearSuffix.
You can restore the default localizations with:
And can then override an individual datepicker for a specific locale:
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.AltField
member.summary: The jQuery selector for another field that is to be updated with the selected date from the datepicker. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-altFormat|altFormat]] setting to change the format of the date within this field. Leave as blank for no alternate field.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.AltFormat
member.summary: The [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] to be used for the [[UI/Datepicker#option-altField|altField]] option. This allows one date format to be shown to the user for selection purposes, while a different format is actually sent behind the scenes. For a full list of the possible formats see the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.AppendText
member.summary: The text to display after each date field, e.g. to show the required format.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.AutoSize
member.summary: Set to true to automatically resize the input field to accommodate dates in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]].

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ButtonImage
member.summary: The URL for the popup button image. If set, [[UI/Datepicker#option-buttonText|buttonText]] becomes the ''alt'' value and is not directly displayed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ButtonImageOnly
member.summary: Set to true to place an image after the field to use as the trigger without it appearing on a button.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display on the trigger button. Use in conjunction with [[UI/Datepicker#option-showOn|showOn]] equal to 'button' or 'both'.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.CalculateWeek
member.summary: myWeekCalc

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ChangeMonth
member.summary: Allows you to change the month by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ChangeYear
member.summary: Allows you to change the year by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-yearRange|yearRange]] option to control which years are made available for selection.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.CloseText
member.summary: The text to display for the close link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-showButtonPanel|showButtonPanel]] to display this button.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ConstrainInput
member.summary: When true entry in the input field is constrained to those characters allowed by the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]].

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.CurrentText
member.summary: The text to display for the current day link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-showButtonPanel|showButtonPanel]] to display this button.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.DateFormat
member.summary: The format for parsed and displayed dates. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. For a full list of the possible formats see the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.DayNames
member.summary: The list of long day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. They also appear as popup hints when hovering over the corresponding column headings. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.DayNamesMin
member.summary: The list of minimised day names, starting from Sunday, for use as column headers within the datepicker. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.DayNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.DefaultDate
member.summary: Set the date to highlight on first opening if the field is blank. Specify either an actual date via a Date object or as a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]], or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +7d'), or null for today.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the widget if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.Duration
member.summary: Control the speed at which the datepicker appears, it may be a time in milliseconds or a string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast").

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.FirstDay
member.summary: Set the first day of the week: Sunday is 0, Monday is 1, ... This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.GotoCurrent
member.summary: When true the current day link moves to the currently selected date instead of today.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.HideIfNoPrevNext
member.summary: Normally the previous and next links are disabled when not applicable (see [[UI/Datepicker#option-minDate|minDate]]/[[UI/Datepicker#option-maxDate|maxDate]]). You can hide them altogether by setting this attribute to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.IsRTL
member.summary: True if the current language is drawn from right to left. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.MaxDate
member.summary: Set a maximum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]], or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +1w'), or null for no limit.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.MinDate
member.summary: Set a minimum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]], or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '-1y -1m'), or null for no limit.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.MonthNames
member.summary: The list of full month names, for use as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.MonthNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated month names, as used in the month header on each datepicker and as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.NavigationAsDateFormat
member.summary: When true the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function is applied to the [[UI/Datepicker#option-prevText|prevText]], [[UI/Datepicker#option-nextText|nextText]], and [[UI/Datepicker#option-currentText|currentText]] values before display, allowing them to display the target month names for example.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.NextText
member.summary: The text to display for the next month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.NumberOfMonths
member.summary: Set how many months to show at once. The value can be a straight integer, or can be a two-element array to define the number of rows and columns to display.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.PrevText
member.summary: The text to display for the previous month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.SelectOtherMonths
member.summary: When true days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if [[UI/Datepicker#option-showOtherMonths|showOtherMonths]] is also true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShortYearCutoff
member.summary: Set the cutoff year for determining the century for a date (used in conjunction with [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] 'y'). If a numeric value (0-99) is provided then this value is used directly. If a string value is provided then it is converted to a number and added to the current year. Once the cutoff year is calculated, any dates entered with a year value less than or equal to it are considered to be in the current century, while those greater than it are deemed to be in the previous century.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowAnim
member.summary: Set the name of the animation used to show/hide the datepicker. Use 'show' (the default), 'slideDown', 'fadeIn', any of the show/hide [http://docs.jquery.com/UI/Effects jQuery UI effects], or "" for no animation.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowButtonPanel
member.summary: Whether to show the button panel.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowCurrentAtPos
member.summary: Specify where in a [[UI/Datepicker#option-numberOfMonths|multi-month]] display the current month shows, starting from 0 at the top/left.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowMonthAfterYear
member.summary: Whether to show the month after the year in the header. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowOn
member.summary: Have the datepicker appear automatically when the field receives focus ("focus"), appear only when a button is clicked ("button"), or appear when either event taks place ("both").

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowOptions
member.summary: If using one of the jQuery UI effects for [[UI/Datepicker#option-showAnim|showAnim]], you can provide additional settings for that animation via this option.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowOtherMonths
member.summary: Display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use [[UI/Datepicker#option-selectOtherMonths|selectOtherMonths]].

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.ShowWeek
member.summary: When true a column is added to show the week of the year. The [[UI/Datepicker#option-calculateWeek|calculateWeek]] option determines how the week of the year is calculated. You may also want to change the [[UI/Datepicker#option-firstDay|firstDay]] option.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.StepMonths
member.summary: Set how many months to move when clicking the Previous/Next links.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.WeekHeader
member.summary: The text to display for the week of the year column heading. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Use [[UI/Datepicker#option-showWeek|showWeek]] to display this column.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.YearRange
member.summary: Control the range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year (-nn:+nn), relative to the currently selected year (c-nn:c+nn), absolute (nnnn:nnnn), or combinations of these formats (nnnn:-nn). Note that this option only affects what appears in the drop-down, to restrict which dates may be selected use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-minDate|minDate]] and/or [[UI/Datepicker#option-maxDate|maxDate]] options.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOption.YearSuffix
member.summary: Additional text to display after the year in the month headers. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions
member.summary: Options used to initialize or customize DatePicker.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.AltField
member.summary: The jQuery selector for another field that is to be updated with the selected date from the datepicker. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-altFormat|altFormat]] setting to change the format of the date within this field. Leave as blank for no alternate field.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.AltFormat
member.summary: The [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] to be used for the [[UI/Datepicker#option-altField|altField]] option. This allows one date format to be shown to the user for selection purposes, while a different format is actually sent behind the scenes. For a full list of the possible formats see the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.AppendText
member.summary: The text to display after each date field, e.g. to show the required format.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.AutoSize
member.summary: Set to true to automatically resize the input field to accommodate dates in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]].

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ButtonImage
member.summary: The URL for the popup button image. If set, [[UI/Datepicker#option-buttonText|buttonText]] becomes the ''alt'' value and is not directly displayed.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ButtonImageOnly
member.summary: Set to true to place an image after the field to use as the trigger without it appearing on a button.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display on the trigger button. Use in conjunction with [[UI/Datepicker#option-showOn|showOn]] equal to 'button' or 'both'.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.CalculateWeek
member.summary: myWeekCalc

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ChangeMonth
member.summary: Allows you to change the month by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ChangeYear
member.summary: Allows you to change the year by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-yearRange|yearRange]] option to control which years are made available for selection.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.CloseText
member.summary: The text to display for the close link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-showButtonPanel|showButtonPanel]] to display this button.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ConstrainInput
member.summary: When true entry in the input field is constrained to those characters allowed by the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]].

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.CurrentText
member.summary: The text to display for the current day link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Use the [[UI/Datepicker#option-showButtonPanel|showButtonPanel]] to display this button.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.DateFormat
member.summary: The format for parsed and displayed dates. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. For a full list of the possible formats see the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.DayNames
member.summary: The list of long day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. They also appear as popup hints when hovering over the corresponding column headings. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.DayNamesMin
member.summary: The list of minimised day names, starting from Sunday, for use as column headers within the datepicker. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.DayNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.DefaultDate
member.summary: Set the date to highlight on first opening if the field is blank. Specify either an actual date via a Date object or as a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]], or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +7d'), or null for today.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.Duration
member.summary: Control the speed at which the datepicker appears, it may be a time in milliseconds or a string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast").

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.FirstDay
member.summary: Set the first day of the week: Sunday is 0, Monday is 1, ... This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.GotoCurrent
member.summary: When true the current day link moves to the currently selected date instead of today.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.HideIfNoPrevNext
member.summary: Normally the previous and next links are disabled when not applicable (see [[UI/Datepicker#option-minDate|minDate]]/[[UI/Datepicker#option-maxDate|maxDate]]). You can hide them altogether by setting this attribute to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.IsRTL
member.summary: True if the current language is drawn from right to left. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MaxDate
member.summary: Set a maximum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]], or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +1w'), or null for no limit.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MinDate
member.summary: Set a minimum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]], or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '-1y -1m'), or null for no limit.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MonthNames
member.summary: The list of full month names, for use as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MonthNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated month names, as used in the month header on each datepicker and as requested via the [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.NavigationAsDateFormat
member.summary: When true the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function is applied to the [[UI/Datepicker#option-prevText|prevText]], [[UI/Datepicker#option-nextText|nextText]], and [[UI/Datepicker#option-currentText|currentText]] values before display, allowing them to display the target month names for example.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.NextText
member.summary: The text to display for the next month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.NumberOfMonths
member.summary: Set how many months to show at once. The value can be a straight integer, or can be a two-element array to define the number of rows and columns to display.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.PrevText
member.summary: The text to display for the previous month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.SelectOtherMonths
member.summary: When true days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if [[UI/Datepicker#option-showOtherMonths|showOtherMonths]] is also true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShortYearCutoff
member.summary: Set the cutoff year for determining the century for a date (used in conjunction with [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] 'y'). If a numeric value (0-99) is provided then this value is used directly. If a string value is provided then it is converted to a number and added to the current year. Once the cutoff year is calculated, any dates entered with a year value less than or equal to it are considered to be in the current century, while those greater than it are deemed to be in the previous century.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowAnim
member.summary: Set the name of the animation used to show/hide the datepicker. Use 'show' (the default), 'slideDown', 'fadeIn', any of the show/hide [http://docs.jquery.com/UI/Effects jQuery UI effects], or "" for no animation.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogObject
member.summary: Open content in an interactive overlay

remarks.para: A dialog is a floating window that contains a title bar and a content area. The dialog window can be moved, resized and closed with the 'x' icon by default.
If the content length exceeds the maximum height, a scrollbar will automatically appear.
A bottom button bar and semi-transparent modal overlay layer are common options that can be added.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogObject.Close
member.summary: Close the dialog.

member.summary: Returns true if the dialog is currently open.

member.summary: Move the dialog to the top of the dialogs stack.

member.summary: Open the dialog.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption
member.summary: Options for use with Dialog.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.AutoOpen
member.summary: When ''autoOpen'' is ''true'' the dialog will open automatically when ''dialog'' is called. If ''false'' it will stay hidden until ''.dialog("open")'' is called on it.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Buttons
member.summary: Specifies which buttons should be displayed on the dialog. Each element of the array must be an Object defining the properties to set on the button.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies whether the dialog should close when it has focus and the user presses the esacpe (ESC) key.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.CloseText
member.summary: Specifies the text for the close button. Note that the close text is visibly hidden when using a standard theme.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.DialogClass
member.summary: The specified class name(s) will be added to the dialog, for additional theming.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the dialog if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Draggable
member.summary: If set to true, the dialog will be draggable by the titlebar.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Height
member.summary: The height of the dialog, in pixels. Specifying 'auto' is also supported to make the dialog adjust based on its content.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Hide
member.summary: The effect to be used when the dialog is closed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.MaxHeight
member.summary: The maximum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.MaxWidth
member.summary: The maximum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.MinHeight
member.summary: The minimum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.MinWidth
member.summary: The minimum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Modal
member.summary: If set to true, the dialog will have modal behavior; other items on the page will be disabled (i.e. cannot be interacted with). Modal dialogs create an overlay below the dialog but above other page elements.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Position
member.summary:
Specifies where the dialog should be displayed. Possible values:
1) a single string representing position within viewport: 'center', 'left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom'.
2) an array containing an x,y coordinate pair in pixel offset from left, top corner of viewport (e.g. [350,100])
3) an array containing x,y position string values (e.g. ['right','top'] for top right corner).

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Resizable
member.summary: If set to true, the dialog will be resizable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Show
member.summary: The effect to be used when the dialog is opened.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Stack
member.summary: Specifies whether the dialog will stack on top of other dialogs. This will cause the dialog to move to the front of other dialogs when it gains focus.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Title
member.summary: Specifies the title of the dialog. Any valid HTML may be set as the title. The title can also be specified by the title attribute on the dialog source element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.Width
member.summary: The width of the dialog, in pixels.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogOption.ZIndex
member.summary: The starting z-index for the dialog.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject
member.summary: Allow mouse interactions with elements, moving them around

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Draggable plugin makes selected elements draggable by mouse.

Draggable elements gets a class of ui-draggable. During drag the element also gets a class of ui-draggable-dragging. If you want not just drag, but drag-and-drop, see the jQuery UI Droppable plugin, which provides a drop target for draggables.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.AddClasses
member.summary: If set to false, will prevent the ui-draggable class from being added. This may be desired as a performance optimization when calling .draggable() init on many hundreds of elements.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.AppendTo
member.summary: The element passed to or selected by the appendTo option will be used as the draggable helper's container during dragging. By default, the helper is appended to the same container as the draggable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Axis
member.summary: Constrains dragging to either the horizontal (x) or vertical (y) axis. Possible values: 'x', 'y'.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Cancel
member.summary: Prevents dragging from starting on specified elements.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.ConnectToSortable
member.summary: Allows the draggable to be dropped onto the specified sortables. If this option is used (helper must be set to 'clone' in order to work flawlessly), a draggable can be dropped onto a sortable list and then becomes part of it.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Containment
member.summary: Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element or region. Possible string values: 'parent', 'document', 'window', [x1, y1, x2, y2].

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Cursor
member.summary: The css cursor during the drag operation.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.CursorAt
member.summary: Sets the offset of the dragging helper relative to the mouse cursor. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds after mousedown until dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the draggable if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Distance
member.summary: Distance in pixels after mousedown the mouse must move before dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Grid
member.summary: Snaps the dragging helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [x, y]

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Handle
member.summary: If specified, restricts drag start click to the specified element(s).

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Helper
member.summary: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display. Possible values: 'original', 'clone', Function. If a function is specified, it must return a DOMElement.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.IframeFix
member.summary: Prevent iframes from capturing the mousemove events during a drag. Useful in combination with cursorAt, or in any case, if the mouse cursor is not over the helper. If set to true, transparent overlays will be placed over all iframes on the page. If a selector is supplied, the matched iframes will have an overlay placed over them.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the helper while being dragged.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.RefreshPositions
member.summary: If set to true, all droppable positions are calculated on every mousemove. Caution: This solves issues on highly dynamic pages, but dramatically decreases performance.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Revert
member.summary: If set to true, the element will return to its start position when dragging stops. Possible string values: 'valid', 'invalid'. If set to invalid, revert will only occur if the draggable has not been dropped on a droppable. For valid, it's the other way around.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.RevertDuration
member.summary: The duration of the revert animation, in milliseconds. Ignored if revert is false.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Scope
member.summary: Used to group sets of draggable and droppable items, in addition to droppable's accept option. A draggable with the same scope value as a droppable will be accepted by the droppable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Scroll
member.summary: If set to true, container auto-scrolls while dragging.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.ScrollSensitivity
member.summary: Distance in pixels from the edge of the viewport after which the viewport should scroll. Distance is relative to pointer, not the draggable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.ScrollSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Snap
member.summary: If set to a selector or to true (equivalent to '.ui-draggable'), the draggable will snap to the edges of the selected elements when near an edge of the element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.SnapMode
member.summary: Determines which edges of snap elements the draggable will snap to. Ignored if snap is false. Possible values: 'inner', 'outer', 'both'

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.SnapTolerance
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the snap element edges at which snapping should occur. Ignored if snap is false.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.Stack
member.summary: Controls the z-Index of the set of elements that match the selector, always brings to front the dragged item. Very useful in things like window managers.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableOption.ZIndex
member.summary: z-index for the helper while being dragged.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableEvents
member.summary: Events raised by Droppable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableEvents.Activate
member.summary: This event is triggered any time an accepted draggable starts dragging. This can be useful if you want to make the droppable 'light up' when it can be dropped on.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableEvents.Create
member.summary: This event is triggered when the droppable is created.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableEvents.Deactivate
member.summary: This event is triggered any time an accepted draggable stops dragging.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableEvents.Drop
member.summary: This event is triggered when an accepted draggable is dropped 'over' (within the tolerance of) this droppable. In the callback, $(this) represents the droppable the draggable is dropped on.ui.draggable represents the draggable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableEvents.Out
member.summary: This event is triggered when an accepted draggable is dragged out (within the tolerance of) this droppable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableEvents.Over
member.summary: This event is triggered as an accepted draggable is dragged 'over' (within the tolerance of) this droppable.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject
member.summary: Create targets for draggable elements

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Droppable plugin makes selected elements droppable (meaning they accept being dropped on by draggables). You can specify which (individually) or which kind of draggables each will accept.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption
member.summary: Options for use with Droppable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.Accept
member.summary: All draggables that match the selector will be accepted. If a function is specified, the function will be called for each draggable on the page (passed as the first argument to the function), to provide a custom filter. The function should return true if the draggable should be accepted.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.ActiveClass
member.summary: If specified, the class will be added to the droppable while an acceptable draggable is being dragged.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.AddClasses
member.summary: If set to false, will prevent the ui-droppable class from being added. This may be desired as a performance optimization when calling .droppable() init on many hundreds of elements.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the droppable if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.Greedy
member.summary: If true, will prevent event propagation on nested droppables.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.HoverClass
member.summary: If specified, the class will be added to the droppable while an acceptable draggable is being hovered.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.Scope
member.summary: Used to group sets of draggable and droppable items, in addition to droppable's accept option. A draggable with the same scope value as a droppable will be accepted.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOption.Tolerance
member.summary:
Specifies which mode to use for testing whether a draggable is 'over' a droppable. Possible values: 'fit', 'intersect', 'pointer', 'touch'.
'''fit''': draggable overlaps the droppable entirely
'''intersect''': draggable overlaps the droppable at least 50%
'''pointer''': mouse pointer overlaps the droppable
'''touch''': draggable overlaps the droppable any amount

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ProgressBarObject
member.summary: Display status of a determinate process

remarks.para: The progress bar is designed to simply display the current percent complete for a process. The bar is coded to be flexibly sized through CSS and will scale to fit inside it's parent container by default.

This is a determinate progress bar, meaning that it should only be used in situations where the system can accurately update the current status complete. A determinate progress bar should never fill from left to right, then loop back to empty for a single process -- if the actual percent complete status cannot be calculated, an indeterminate progress bar or spinner animation is a better way to provide user feedback.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableObject
member.summary: Change the size of an element using the mouse

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Resizable plugin makes selected elements resizable (meaning they have draggable resize handles). You can specify one or more handles as well as min and max width and height.
All callbacks (start,stop,resize) receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object.
This interaction requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the interaction's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption
member.summary: Options for use with Resizable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.AlsoResize
member.summary: Resize these elements synchronous when resizing.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Animate
member.summary: Animates to the final size after resizing.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.AnimateDuration
member.summary: Duration time for animating, in milliseconds. Other possible values: 'slow', 'normal', 'fast'.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.AnimateEasing
member.summary: Easing effect for animating.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.AspectRatio
member.summary: If set to true, resizing is constrained by the original aspect ratio. Otherwise a custom aspect ratio can be specified, such as 9 / 16, or 0.5.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.AutoHide
member.summary: If set to true, automatically hides the handles except when the mouse hovers over the element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Cancel
member.summary: Prevents resizing if you start on elements matching the selector.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Containment
member.summary: Constrains resizing to within the bounds of the specified element. Possible values: 'parent', 'document', a DOMElement, or a Selector.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Delay
member.summary: Tolerance, in milliseconds, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond duration. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the resizable if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond distance. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Ghost
member.summary: If set to true, a semi-transparent helper element is shown for resizing.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Grid
member.summary: Snaps the resizing element to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [x, y]

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Handles
member.summary:
If specified as a string, should be a comma-split list of any of the following: 'n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw, all'. The necessary handles will be auto-generated by the plugin.
If specified as an object, the following keys are supported: { n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw }. The value of any specified should be a jQuery selector matching the child element of the resizable to use as that handle. If the handle is not a child of the resizable, you can pass in the DOMElement or a valid jQuery object directly.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.Helper
member.summary: This is the css class that will be added to a proxy element to outline the resize during the drag of the resize handle. Once the resize is complete, the original element is sized.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.MaxHeight
member.summary: This is the maximum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

member.summary: This is the maximum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

member.summary: This is the minimum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.ResizableOption.MinWidth
member.summary: This is the minimum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

member.summary: Refresh the position and size of each selectee element. This method can be used to manually recalculate the position and size of each selectee element. Very useful if autoRefresh is set to false.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableObject
member.summary: Use the mouse to select individual or a group of elements

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Selectable plugin allows for elements to be selected by dragging a box (sometimes called a lasso) with the mouse over the elements. Also, elements can be selected by click or drag while holding the Ctrl/Meta key, allowing for multiple (non-contiguous) selections.
This interaction requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the interaction's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableObject.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh the position and size of each selectee element. This method can be used to manually recalculate the position and size of each selectee element. Very useful if autoRefresh is set to false.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption
member.summary: Options for use with Selectable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption.AutoRefresh
member.summary: This determines whether to refresh (recalculate) the position and size of each selectee at the beginning of each select operation. If you have many many items, you may want to set this to false and call the refresh method manually.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption.Cancel
member.summary: Prevents selecting if you start on elements matching the selector.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption.Delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds to define when the selecting should start. It helps preventing unwanted selections when clicking on an element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the selectable if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption.Distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when selecting should start. If specified, selecting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption.Filter
member.summary: The matching child elements will be made selectees (able to be selected).

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SelectableOption.Tolerance
member.summary:
Possible values: 'touch', 'fit'.
'''fit''': draggable overlaps the droppable entirely
'''touch''': draggable overlaps the droppable any amount

member.summary: The distance of the effect. Is set to either the height or width of the elemenet depending on the direction option. Can be set to any integer less than the width/height of the element.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Effects.SlideOptions.Duration
member.summary: The number of ms the animation will run for

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Effects.SlideOptions.Easing
member.summary: The easing function to use

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Effects.SlideOptions.Mode

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderEvents
member.summary: Events raised by Slider.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderEvents.Change
member.summary: This event is triggered on slide stop, or if the value is changed programmatically (by the value method). Takes arguments event and ui. Use event.originalEvent to detect whether the value changed by mouse, keyboard, or programmatically. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the current handle, $(this).slider('values', index) to get another handle's value.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderEvents.Create
member.summary: This event is triggered when the slider is created.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderEvents.Slide
member.summary: This event is triggered on every mouse move during slide. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the current handle, $(..).slider('value', index) to get another handles' value.Return false in order to prevent a slide, based on ui.value.

member.summary: This event is triggered when the user starts sliding.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderEvents.Stop

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the slider. For single handle sliders.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderMethod.Values
member.summary: Number

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderObject
member.summary: Drag a handle to select a numeric value
member.remarks:
The jQuery UI Slider plugin makes selected elements into sliders. There are various options such as multiple handles, and ranges. The handle can be moved with the mouse or the arrow keys.The start, slide, and stop callbacks receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object, view below for a documentation of this object (if you name your second argument 'ui'):The slider widget will create handle elements with the class 'ui-slider-handle' on initialization. You can specify custom handle elements by creating and appending the elements and adding the 'ui-slider-handle' class before init. It will only create the number of handles needed to match the length of value/values. For example, if you specify 'values: [1, 5, 18]' and create one custom handle, the plugin will create the other two.
ui.handle: DOMElement - the current focused handle
ui.value: Integer - the current handle's value
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderObject.Value(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the slider. For single handle sliders.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderObject.Values(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Number

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption
member.summary: Options for use with Slider.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Animate
member.summary: Whether to slide handle smoothly when user click outside handle on the bar. Will also accept a string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000).

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the slider if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Max
member.summary: The maximum value of the slider.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the slider.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Orientation
member.summary: This option determines whether the slider has the min at the left, the max at the right or the min at the bottom, the max at the top. Possible values: 'horizontal', 'vertical'.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Range
member.summary: If set to true, the slider will detect if you have two handles and create a stylable range element between these two. Two other possible values are 'min' and 'max'. A min range goes from the slider min to one handle. A max range goes from one handle to the slider max.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Step
member.summary: Determines the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between min and max. The full specified value range of the slider (max - min) needs to be evenly divisible by the step.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Value
member.summary: Determines the value of the slider, if there's only one handle. If there is more than one handle, determines the value of the first handle.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderOption.Values
member.summary: This option can be used to specify multiple handles. If range is set to true, the length of 'values' should be 2.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.Activate
member.summary: This event is triggered when using connected lists, every connected list on drag start receives it.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.BeforeStop
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting stops, but when the placeholder/helper is still available.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.Change
member.summary: This event is triggered during sorting, but only when the DOM position has changed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.Create
member.summary: This event is triggered when the sortable is created.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.Deactivate
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting was stopped, is propagated to all possible connected lists.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.Out
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item is moved away from a connected list.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.Over
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item is moved into a connected list.

member.summary: This event is triggered when a connected sortable list has received an item from another list.

member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item has been dragged out from the list and into another.

member.summary: This event is triggered during sorting.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableEvents.Start
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting starts.

member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting has stopped.
