member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableMethod
member.summary: Operations supported by Sortable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableMethod.Cancel
member.summary:
Cancels a change in the current sortable and reverts it to the state prior to when the current sort was started. Useful in the stop and receive callback functions.
If the sortable item is not being moved from one connected sortable to another:$(this).sortable('cancel');will cancel the change.
If the sortable item is being moved from one connected sortable to another:$(ui.sender).sortable('cancel');will cancel the change. Useful in the 'receive' callback.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableMethod.Destroy
member.summary: The destroy() method cleans up all common data, events, etc. and then delegates out to _destroy() for custom cleanup.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableMethod.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh the sortable items. Custom trigger the reloading of all sortable items, causing new items to be recognized.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableMethod.RefreshPositions
member.summary: Refresh the cached positions of the sortables' items. Calling this method refreshes the cached item positions of all sortables. This is usually done automatically by the script and slows down performance. Use wisely.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableMethod.Serialize
member.summary:
Serializes the sortable's item id's into a form/ajax submittable string. Calling this method produces a hash that can be appended to any url to easily submit a new item order back to the server.
It works by default by looking at the id of each item in the format 'setname_number', and it spits out a hash like "setname[]=number&setname[]=number".
You can also give in a option hash as second argument to custom define how the function works. The possible options are: 'key' (replaces part1[] with whatever you want), 'attribute' (test another attribute than 'id') and 'expression' (use your own regexp).
If serialize returns an empty string, make sure the id attributes include an underscore. They must be in the form: "set_number" For example, a 3 element list with id attributes foo_1, foo_5, foo_2 will serialize to foo[]=1&foo[]=5&foo[]=2. You can use an underscore, equal sign or hyphen to separate the set and number. For example foo=1 or foo-1 or foo_1 all serialize to foo[]=1.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject
member.summary: Reorder elements in a list or grid using the mouse

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Sortable plugin makes selected elements sortable by dragging with the mouse.
All callbacks receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Cancel
member.summary:
Cancels a change in the current sortable and reverts it to the state prior to when the current sort was started. Useful in the stop and receive callback functions.
If the sortable item is not being moved from one connected sortable to another:$(this).sortable('cancel');will cancel the change.
If the sortable item is being moved from one connected sortable to another:$(ui.sender).sortable('cancel');will cancel the change. Useful in the 'receive' callback.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh the sortable items. Custom trigger the reloading of all sortable items, causing new items to be recognized.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.RefreshPositions
member.summary: Refresh the cached positions of the sortables' items. Calling this method refreshes the cached item positions of all sortables. This is usually done automatically by the script and slows down performance. Use wisely.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary:
Serializes the sortable's item id's into a form/ajax submittable string. Calling this method produces a hash that can be appended to any url to easily submit a new item order back to the server.
It works by default by looking at the id of each item in the format 'setname_number', and it spits out a hash like "setname[]=number&setname[]=number".
You can also give in a option hash as second argument to custom define how the function works. The possible options are: 'key' (replaces part1[] with whatever you want), 'attribute' (test another attribute than 'id') and 'expression' (use your own regexp).
If serialize returns an empty string, make sure the id attributes include an underscore. They must be in the form: "set_number" For example, a 3 element list with id attributes foo_1, foo_5, foo_2 will serialize to foo[]=1&foo[]=5&foo[]=2. You can use an underscore, equal sign or hyphen to separate the set and number. For example foo=1 or foo-1 or foo_1 all serialize to foo[]=1.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption
member.summary: Options for use with Sortable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.AppendTo
member.summary: Defines where the helper that moves with the mouse is being appended to during the drag (for example, to resolve overlap/zIndex issues).

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Axis
member.summary: If defined, the items can be dragged only horizontally or vertically. Possible values:'x', 'y'.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Cancel
member.summary: Prevents sorting if you start on elements matching the selector.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.ConnectWith
member.summary: Takes a jQuery selector with items that also have sortables applied. If used, the sortable is now connected to the other one-way, so you can drag from this sortable to the other.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Containment
member.summary:
Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element - can be a DOM element, 'parent', 'document', 'window', or a jQuery selector.
Note: the element specified for containment must have a calculated width and height (though it need not be explicit), so for example, if you have float:left sortable children and specify containment:'parent' be sure to have float:left on the sortable/parent container as well or it will have height: 0, causing undefined behavior.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Cursor
member.summary: Defines the cursor that is being shown while sorting.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.CursorAt
member.summary: Moves the sorting element or helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds to define when the sorting should start. It helps preventing unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the sortable if set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when sorting should start. If specified, sorting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance. Can be used to allow for clicks on elements within a handle.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.DropOnEmpty
member.summary: If false items from this sortable can't be dropped to an empty linked sortable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.ForceHelperSize
member.summary: If true, forces the helper to have a size.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.ForcePlaceholderSize
member.summary: If true, forces the placeholder to have a size.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Grid
member.summary: Snaps the sorting element or helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [x, y]

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Handle
member.summary: Restricts sort start click to the specified element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Helper
member.summary: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display. The supplied function receives the event and the element being sorted, and should return a DOMElement to be used as a custom proxy helper. Possible values: 'original', 'clone'

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Items
member.summary: Specifies which items inside the element should be sortable.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Opacity
member.summary: Defines the opacity of the helper while sorting. From 0.01 to 1

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Placeholder
member.summary: Class that gets applied to the otherwise white space.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Revert
member.summary: If set to true, the item will be reverted to its new DOM position with a smooth animation. Optionally, it can also be set to a number that controls the duration of the animation in ms.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Scroll
member.summary: If set to true, the page scrolls when coming to an edge.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.ScrollSensitivity
member.summary: Defines how near the mouse must be to an edge to start scrolling.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.ScrollSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.Tolerance
member.summary:
This is the way the reordering behaves during drag. Possible values: 'intersect', 'pointer'. In some setups, 'pointer' is more natural.
'''intersect''': draggable overlaps the droppable at least 50%
'''pointer''': mouse pointer overlaps the droppable

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOption.ZIndex
member.summary: Z-index for element/helper while being sorted.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Add
member.summary: Add a new tab. The second argument is either a URL consisting of a fragment identifier only to create an in-page tab or a full url (relative or absolute, no cross-domain support) to turn the new tab into an Ajax (remote) tab. The third is the zero-based position where to insert the new tab. Optional, by default a new tab is appended at the end.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Destroy
member.summary: The destroy() method cleans up all common data, events, etc. and then delegates out to _destroy() for custom cleanup.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Length
member.summary: Retrieve the number of tabs of the first matched tab pane.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Load
member.summary: Load the panel content of a remote tab (specified by index)

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Remove
member.summary: Remove a tab. The second argument is the zero-based index of the tab to be removed. Instead of an index, the href of the tab may be passed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Rotate
member.summary: Set up an automatic rotation through tabs of a tab pane. The second argument is an amount of time in milliseconds until the next tab in the cycle gets activated. Use 0 or null to stop the rotation. The third controls whether or not to continue the rotation after a tab has been selected by a user. Default: false.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Select
member.summary: Select a tab, as if it were clicked. The second argument is the zero-based index of the tab to be selected or the id selector of the panel the tab is associated with (the tab's href fragment identifier, e.g. hash, points to the panel's id).

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsMethod.Url
member.summary: Change the url from which an Ajax (remote) tab will be loaded. The specified URL will be used for subsequent loads. Note that you can not only change the URL for an existing remote tab with this method, but also turn an in-page tab into a remote tab. The second argument is the zero-based index of the tab of which its URL is to be updated. The third is a URL the content of the tab is loaded from.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsObject
member.summary: A single content area with multiple panels, each associated with a header in a list

remarks.para: Tabs are generally used to break content into multiple sections that can be swapped to save space, much like an accordion.
By default a tab widget will swap between tabbed sections on click, but the events can be changed to onHover through an option. Tab content can be loaded via Ajax by setting an href on a tab.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsObject.Abort
member.summary: Terminate all running tab ajax requests and animations.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsObject.Add(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Add a new tab. The second argument is either a URL consisting of a fragment identifier only to create an in-page tab or a full url (relative or absolute, no cross-domain support) to turn the new tab into an Ajax (remote) tab. The third is the zero-based position where to insert the new tab. Optional, by default a new tab is appended at the end.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsObject.Disable(System.Object)
member.summary:
Disable a tab. The selected tab cannot be disabled. To disable more than one tab at once use: $('#example').tabs("option","disabled", [1, 2, 3]);
The argument is the zero-based index of the tab to be disabled. Instead of an index, the href of the tab may be passed.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsObject.Enable(System.Object)
member.summary:
Enable a disabled tab. To enable more than one tab at once reset the disabled property like: $('#example').tabs("option","disabled",[]);.
The argument is the zero-based index of the tab to be enabled. Instead of an index, the href of the tab may be passed.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsOption
member.summary: Options for use with Tabs.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsOption.Active
member.summary:
The zero-based index of the panel that is active (open). A negative value select panels going backward from the last panel.
When collapsible is set to true, a false value closes the accordion, otherwise nothing happens

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsOption.Collapsible
member.summary: Allow the active panel to be closed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsOption.Disabled
member.summary: An array containing the position of the tabs (zero-based index) that should be disabled.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsOption.Event
member.summary: The type of event to be used for activating a tab. To activate on hover, use "mouseover".

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsOption.HeightStyle
member.summary:
Controls the height of the tabs widget and each panel. Possible values:
auto: all panels will be set to the height of the tallest panel
fill: expand to the available height based on the tabs's parent height
content: each panel will be only as tall as its content

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsOption.Hide
member.summary: How to hide a panel.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Effects.TransferObject
member.summary: Transfers the outline of an element to another element
member.remarks:
Very useful when trying to visualize interaction between two elements.
The transfer element iself has the class name "ui-effects-transfer", and needs to be styled by you, for example by adding a background or border.
